org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel

Interface Dataflow

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Annotated<Dataflow>, NamedWorkflowEntity, TokenProcessingEntity, WorkflowItem
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataflowImpl

    @ControlBoundary
public interface Dataflow
extends Annotated<Dataflow>, TokenProcessingEntity, WorkflowItem
    Top level definition object for a dataflow workflow. Currently Taverna only supports dataflow workflows, this is equivalent to the Taverna 1 ScuflModel class in role.
    Author:
    Tom Oinn

    • Method Detail

      • getProcessors

        @HierarchyTraversal(hierarchies="workflowStructure",
                    role=CHILD)
List<? extends Processor> getProcessors()
        A Dataflow consists of a set of named Processor instances. This method returns an unmodifiable list of these processors. Equivalent to calling getEntities(Processor.class).
        Returns:
        list of all processors in the dataflow

      • getMerges

        @HierarchyTraversal(hierarchies="workflowStructure",
                    role=CHILD)
List<? extends Merge> getMerges()
        Dataflows also contain a set of merge operations, this method returns an unmodifiable copy of the set. Equivalent to calling getEntities(Merge.class)

      • getInputPorts

        @HierarchyTraversal(hierarchies="workflowStructure",
                    role=CHILD)
List<? extends DataflowInputPort> getInputPorts()
        Dataflows have a list of input ports. These are the input ports the world outside the dataflow sees - each one contains an internal output port which is used to forward events on to entities (mostly processors) within the dataflow.
        Specified by:
        getInputPorts in interface TokenProcessingEntity
        Returns:
        list of dataflow input port instances

      • getEntities

        <T extends NamedWorkflowEntity> List<? extends T> getEntities(Class<T> entityType)
        Get all workflow entities with the specified type restriction, this allows retrieval of Processor, Merge, a mix of the two or any other future entity to be added to the workflow model without a significant change in this part of the API.
        Parameters:
        entityType - a class of the type specified by the type variable T. All entities returned in the list can be cast to this type
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of entities of the specified type

      • getOutputPorts

        @HierarchyTraversal(hierarchies="workflowStructure",
                    role=CHILD)
List<? extends DataflowOutputPort> getOutputPorts()
        Dataflows have a list of output ports. The output port in a dataflow is the port visible to the outside world and from which the dataflow emits events. Each dataflow output port also contains an instance of event receiving input port which is used by entities within the dataflow to push events to the corresponding external output port.
        Specified by:
        getOutputPorts in interface TokenProcessingEntity
        Returns:
        list of dataflow output port instances

      • getLinks

        @HierarchyTraversal(hierarchies="workflowStructure",
                    role=CHILD)
List<? extends Datalink> getLinks()
        The dataflow is largely defined by the links between processors and other entities within its scope. This method returns them.
        Returns:
        list of Datalink implementations

      • checkValidity

        DataflowValidationReport checkValidity()
        Triggers a check for various basic potential problems with the workflow, in particular ones related to type checking. Returns a report object containing the state of the workflow and any problems found.

        If the workflow has been set immutable with setImmutable(), subsequent calls to this method will return the cached DataflowValidationReport.

        Returns:
        validation report

      • fire

        void fire(String owningProcess,
          InvocationContext context)
        A dataflow with no inputs cannot be driven by the supply of data tokens as it has nowhere to receive such tokens. This method allows a dataflow to fire on an empty input set, in this case the owning process identifier must be passed explicitly to the dataflow. This method then calls the fire methods of any Processor instances with no input ports.

      • getFailureTransmitter

        FailureTransmitter getFailureTransmitter()
        The failure transmitter contains event listeners to be notified of workflow level failures - these occur when an error bubbles up to the top of the dispatch stack in a processor and is not handled by conversion to an error token within the data stream.

        Listeners are messaged after all clean-up has been performed on the dataflow's internal state and that of any child operations within it, guaranteeing that no tokens will be generated with the id of the failed process after the message has been received by the listener

      • getIdentifier

        String getIdentifier()
        An identifier that is unique to this dataflow and its current state. The identifier will change whenever the dataflow is modified.
        Returns:
        a String representing a unique internal identifier.

      • recordIdentifier

        String recordIdentifier()

      • isInputPortConnected

        boolean isInputPortConnected(DataflowInputPort inputPort)
        Check if the given input port is connected to anything in the workflow.
        Parameters:
        inputPort -
        Returns:
        true if the given workflow input port is connected, false otherwise.

      • setImmutable

        void setImmutable()
        Mark this dataflow as immutable. Subsequent edits to its ports, links, merges, input and output ports will throw a RuntimeException like UnsupportedOperationException. This method should be called before executing a Dataflow with fire(String, InvocationContext), in order to guarantee that datalinks, port depths etc. don't change while the dataflow is running.
